intro: Sison rubricaule, commonly known as the red-stemmed sison, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive red-tinged stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Sison rubricaule is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some areas.
